data.text: @DoNotGaslightMe @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO I had all kinds of issues but they were digestive, not mitochondrial... or at least I think... I don't TECHNICALLY know.

@DoNotGaslightMe @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO I had post-acute sequelae from a really bad flu around 2008 or 09.... and I didn't even connect that's what it was until I had Long COVID and even then... I didn't recognize the brain fog until I got rid of all it about three months ago.

@DonEford @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO Yes and in the US at least, we’re conditioned to avoid going to doctors because it’s not cheap. If you can convince yourself that you’re ‘just tired’ or ‘just getting older’ than you can totally avoid confronting your long covid.

@DoNotGaslightMe @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO There is a strong Zero COVID community building that is supporting each other, many have Long COVID or are high risk so it comes with a lot of risk.

But our community is what is going to get us through this and right now that's not really working out locally.

@DonEford @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO I’m really frustrated by our public health folks minimizing this for what I believe are purely ‘customer support’ reasons. I feel like I’m on an island :)

@DoNotGaslightMe @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO I'm glad you liked it... the next one is brain invasion and what a real off-ramp looks like.

I also have more updates for that article as each individual idea has more information or has been better flushed out... lots of new data in the last 2 weeks supportive of my theories
@DonEford @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO Thank you. As a biologist I appreciate the detail but the nontechnical parts are extremely effective. Learned lots.

@DonEford @DoNotGaslightMe @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO This is an absurd claim.

When I was 100lbs overweight, my symptoms would have probably been much worse. 

But, that's not the case. 

"Ignorance from long covid" may happen to those in the overweight & already sick category. Taking meds, etc.

Get lean & fit. Don't take drugs.

@DoNotGaslightMe @fishinthisweek @KrutikaKuppalli @WHO I suspect that the symptoms are there the whole time but it's only as the brain heals from the cytokine response we become aware of the symptoms and consequently think they are new.
